snippet/article:
Alan Turing (1912–1954) was a pioneering mathematician, logician, and computer scientist, known for his contributions to the development of the modern computer.

Turing's family background provided a supportive environment for his intellectual pursuits. His father, Julius Mathison Turing, was a member of the Indian Civil Service and his mother, Ethel Sara Turing, had a keen interest in mathematics. While there is no direct evidence of extraordinary intellectual abilities in his parents, their encouragement likely played a role in Alan's early development as a mathematician.

Alan Turing never married and did not have any children.
Subject: Alan Turing
